articles.headline: Joe Biden Has the Vision. Now Chuck Schumer Has to Bring It to Life.
articles.snippet: The Senate majority leader, marking his own 100 days in charge, is responsible for turning sweeping Democratic plans into law. It’s a tall order.
articles.abstract: The Senate majority leader, marking his own 100 days in charge, is responsible for turning sweeping Democratic plans into law. It’s a tall order.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden laid out his ambitious vision for a post-pandemic America on Wednesday night. Now it is up to Senator Chuck Schumer to make it a reality.

articles.headline: After a Year of Loss, South America Suffers Worst Death Tolls Yet
articles.snippet: If the world doesn’t stop the region’s surging caseload, it could cost us all that we’ve done to fight the pandemic, one health official said.
articles.abstract: If the world doesn’t stop the region’s surging caseload, it could cost us all that we’ve done to fight the pandemic, one health official said.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOGOTÁ, Colombia — In the capital of Colombia, Bogotá, the mayor is warning residents to brace for “the worst two weeks of our lives.”
articles.byline: By Julie Turkewitz and Mitra Taj

articles.headline: ‘A Perfect Positive Storm’: Bonkers Dollars for Big Tech
articles.snippet: The dictionary doesn’t have enough superlatives to describe what’s happening to the five biggest technology companies, raising uncomfortable questions for their C.E.O.s.
articles.abstract: The dictionary doesn’t have enough superlatives to describe what’s happening to the five biggest technology companies, raising uncomfortable questions for their C.E.O.s.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the Great Recession more than a decade ago, big tech companies hit a rough patch just like everyone else. Now they have become unquestioned winners of the pandemic economy.
